name: Jumeirah Creekside Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great service being offered by everyone especially Katy in the Cuba bar with only a few issues. (pool on the roof not yet filled, no knowledge by some staff of Jumeriah Summer Flavours offer, soon sorted by supervisor)
reviews.title: New Dubai hotel with great service

reviews.text: We stayed 6 night on Summer Flavour promotions in 2 connecting rooms in the first opening week of the JCH.
reviews.title: Rough start at the JCH

reviews.text: We arrived late in the evening from AD airport. Check in was fine. I had a discussion with reception staff about the obliged blocked amount on my creditcard. I think 400 euro’s a day above the roomprice was way too much considering breakfast and dinner was already in our room rate. After a while they agreed and only blocked an acceptable amount.
reviews.title: A M A Z I N G!!

reviews.text: Great advantage of the hotel is the 24 hours check in/out facility. So we checked in at around 23.00 hours and checked out 6 days later at the same time (had a night flight from AD to KL).
reviews.title: Sparkling new

reviews.text: The rooms are very state of the art, very modern, luxurious and have the most comfortable beds you can imagine BUT our first nights were rather disastrous:
reviews.title: Potential to becoming a great hotel

reviews.text: The airco didn’t work properly during our first night. It stayed hot until the next evening.
reviews.title: Brand New Great hotel in Deira

reviews.text: Brand new hotel very close to the airport. Offers 24-hour checkout, which, along with the location makes it a great choice for transit passengers, especially considering that a lot of flights land or take off in the middle of the night. Many taxi drivers don't know about it so better carry the full address and telephone number.
reviews.title: Convenient and very new, needs to iron out minor kinks

reviews.text: Modernistic hotel with a red color theme, which comes off reasonably well. The bedrooms and bathrooms are large and well-designed, with free wi-fi. My room had a view of a construction site, but I expect it should be better if you get a room on the other side. The plumbing does have some issue, with shower temperature fluctuating at the same lever location. Didn't get scalded but came close to it! Also the electronic room lock wasn't reliable - once I shut my room, went out for dinner and came back a couple of hours later to find my room wasn't locked and I could push the door open without a key!
reviews.title: Compliments to the JCH team! A+

reviews.text: The concierge was very friendly and helpful, but the reception staff need more training. At check-in, the chap insisted on taking a credit card authorization for twice my room charge, and at check out, the staff didn't know that this authorization had been taken. Had to find my charge slip to prove this, and then they took their time to sort it out.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel for Business

reviews.text: The Irish Village nearby is great for a drink. Was on a tight schedule, so didn't check out the pool or the other restaurants. The metro station is a 5-7 minutes' walk, but taxis in Dubai are plentiful and cheap. They also have a shuttle service to major malls and to the Madinat Jumeirah beach, but these are slow and infrequent. You can get a ticket for free access to the Wild Wadi water park and to the Madinat Jumeirah beach, but these are pretty far away.
reviews.title: fabulous property,great stay!!

reviews.text: Minor kinks (which I expect will be set right soon) aside, this is a great hotel at a reasonable price, with 24 hour checkout and free wifi, but if you want to hit the beaches, better stay closer to Jumeirah.
reviews.title: Without doubt the best hotel I have stayed at...

reviews.text: Very large room and bathroom of high standard, excellent staff which are very friendly and quick to help. Very convenient location just a few minutes from the airport, yet there is no aircraft noise. I am told the creekside area is also good for leisure but unfortunately did not have time to check that out.
reviews.title: Great room and service even for Dubai

reviews.text: Nice rooftop pool and bar, again with great staff.
reviews.title: Minimalist beauty

reviews.text: Hotel is not yet fully opened and there were some minor technical issues in the room, but they were swiftly dealt with and some complimentary goods were sent for the trouble.
reviews.title: very good hotel but strange security employee..

reviews.text: In all a very good choice both for a temporary layover and longer business stays.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: Minimalist design, to the point of starkness, is an acquired taste, particularly in gaudy Dubai, but the Creekside nearly gets the balance right. Our two adjoining superior rooms were comfortable and quiet. We took advantage of the 24 hour check in service, and had no problems getting into our room at 6.30 am! The only downside was no hot water on the morning of our early departure, which really put us off. Apparently, the problem was "outside the hotel's control" but still a bit surprising for a 5 star operation. Other than that, highly recommended!
reviews.title: Wonderful interiors yet one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in!

description: Located in the heart of Dubai, just moments away from the international airport, Jumeirah Creekside Hotel is a contemporary lifestyle destination and feautres a dedicated Arts and Cultural Program.Set amongst verdant green grounds, Jumeirah Creekside Hotel seamlessly fuses the grace of a distinguished country club with all the luxuries of a modern city hotel. Jumeirah Creekside Hotel distils the heritage of Dubai’s Creek with the distinct flair of Jumeirah’s high standards in luxury and service.
